intro: Nassauvia glabrata, commonly known as the smoothleaf nassauvia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Geraniaceae family and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and clusters of small, pink to red flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is well adapted to arid environments. It produces capsule fruits that contain several seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Nassauvia glabrata is often used in xeriscaping due to its low water requirements and ornamental value.
